body: ### Bio James Bloomer has a PhD in particle physics (he studied Tau Leptons at CERN) and has probably forgotten more physics than most people ever learn. He won the 2010 James White Award and the winning story was published in Interzone. His stories have appeared in Daily Science Fiction, DayBreak Magazine and a selection of other magazines. He writes software for a living, runs the blog Big Dumb Object and you can find him on Twitter @bigdumbobject. ### Bibliography - [Extended Periods Of Absence](http://www.kaleidotrope.net/home/extended-periods-of-absence-by-james-bloomer/) - [Kaleidotrope](http://www.kaleidotrope.net/) (July 5, 2012) - [Trails](http://dailysciencefiction.com/story/james-bloomer/trails) - [Daily Science Fiction](http://dailysciencefiction.com) (August 9, 2011) - Searching, Hiding, Leaving - Eschatology - The Journal of Lovecraftian and Apocalyptic Fiction (April 14, 2011) - Flock, Shoal, Herd - James White Award ( June 19, 2010) - Together - A Fly In Amber (March 26, 2010) - The Rules Of Utopia - DayBreak Magazine (March 19, 2010) - Build, Build, Build - Every Day Fiction (March 5, 2010) - Reboot - Short-Story.me (November 24, 2009) - The Kite - Staffs & Starships (April 19, 2009) - Surf Town - Focus (March 1, 2009) - Save Tomorrow With A Smiley - Big Pulp Magazine (November 9, 2008) - The Paths You Would Walk - Every Day Fiction (March 18, 2008) - A Letter Of Complaint - Spacesuits And Sixguns (January 18, 2008) - Alone - Every Day Fiction (November 3, 2007) - What's In A Memory? - Atomjack Magazine (July 11, 2006)
